Gregory of Tours cites one example of an adulterous woman condemned to burn; Godfrey of Viterbo recounts that Marla of Aragon, wife of Otto III, was burned for an attempted adultery; St. Florent of Saumur alleges that Fulk of Nerra burned his wife Elizabeth because of a suspicion of adultery.
